trans-unit.source: Install ATA | Microsoft ATA
trans-unit.target: Install ATA | Microsoft ATA

trans-unit.source: In the final step of installing ATA, you configure the short-term lease subnets and the Honeytoken user.
trans-unit.target: In the final step of installing ATA, you configure the short-term lease subnets and the Honeytoken user.

trans-unit.source: *Applies to: Advanced Threat Analytics version 1.7*
trans-unit.target: *Applies to: Advanced Threat Analytics version 1.7*

trans-unit.source: Install ATA - Step 6
trans-unit.target: Install ATA - Step 6

trans-unit.source: [« Step 5](install-ata-step5.md)
trans-unit.target: [« Step 5](install-ata-step5.md)

trans-unit.source: Step 6.
trans-unit.target: Step 6.

trans-unit.source: Configure IP address exclusions and Honeytoken user
trans-unit.target: Configure IP address exclusions and Honeytoken user

trans-unit.source: ATA enables the exclusion of specific IP addresses and IP subnets from two types of detections: **DNS Reconnaissance** and **Pass-the-Ticket**.
trans-unit.target: ATA enables the exclusion of specific IP addresses and IP subnets from two types of detections: **DNS Reconnaissance** and **Pass-the-Ticket**.

trans-unit.source: For example, a **DNS Reconnaissance exclusion** could be a security scanner that uses DNS as a scanning mechanism.
trans-unit.target: For example, a **DNS Reconnaissance exclusion** could be a security scanner that uses DNS as a scanning mechanism.

trans-unit.source: The exclusion helps ATA ignore such scanners.
trans-unit.target: The exclusion helps ATA ignore such scanners.

trans-unit.source: An example of a *Pass-the-Ticket* exclusion is a NAT device.
trans-unit.target: An example of a *Pass-the-Ticket* exclusion is a NAT device.

trans-unit.source: ATA also enables the configuration of a Honeytoken user, which is used as a trap for malicious actors - any authentication associated with this (normally dormant) account will trigger an alert.
trans-unit.target: ATA also enables the configuration of a Honeytoken user, which is used as a trap for malicious actors - any authentication associated with this (normally dormant) account will trigger an alert.

trans-unit.source: To configure the above, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure the above, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: From the ATA Console, click on the settings icon and select **Configuration**.
trans-unit.target: From the ATA Console, click on the settings icon and select **Configuration**.

trans-unit.source: ATA configuration settings
trans-unit.target: ATA configuration settings

trans-unit.source: Under **Detection exclusions**, enter the following for either *DNS Reconnaissance* or *Pass-the-Ticket* IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: Under **Detection exclusions**, enter the following for either *DNS Reconnaissance* or *Pass-the-Ticket* IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: Use CIDR format, for example: `192.168.1.0/24` and click the *plus* sign.
trans-unit.target: Use CIDR format, for example: `192.168.1.0/24` and click the *plus* sign.

trans-unit.source: Save changes
trans-unit.target: Save changes

trans-unit.source: Under **Detection settings** enter the Honeytoken account SIDs and click the plus sign.
trans-unit.target: Under **Detection settings** enter the Honeytoken account SIDs and click the plus sign.

trans-unit.source: ATA configuration settings
trans-unit.target: ATA configuration settings

trans-unit.source: To find the SID for a user, search for the user in the ATA Console, and then click on the **Account Info** tab.
trans-unit.target: To find the SID for a user, search for the user in the ATA Console, and then click on the **Account Info** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Congratulations, you have successfully deployed Microsoft Advanced Threat Analytics!
trans-unit.target: Congratulations, you have successfully deployed Microsoft Advanced Threat Analytics!

trans-unit.source: Check the attack time line to view detected suspicious activities and search for users or computers and view their profiles.
trans-unit.target: Check the attack time line to view detected suspicious activities and search for users or computers and view their profiles.

trans-unit.source: ATA will start scanning for suspicious activities immediately.
trans-unit.target: ATA will start scanning for suspicious activities immediately.

trans-unit.source: Some activities, such as some of the suspicious behavior activities, will not be available until ATA has had time to build behavioral profiles (minimum of three weeks).
trans-unit.target: Some activities, such as some of the suspicious behavior activities, will not be available until ATA has had time to build behavioral profiles (minimum of three weeks).
